questions.question_text:
A system shows high utilization of swap space but low utilization of physical memory.
Which of the following commands should an administrator run to free up usable swap space?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
journalctl -u will list the log entries associated with the httpd unit.

Selected Answer: A
-u, --unit=UNIT|PATTERN
 Show messages for the specified systemd unit UNIT (such as a
 service unit), or for any of the units matched by PATTERN.

questions.question_text:
A company's httpd server has stopped working and restarting the service does not fix the issue. A junior systems administrator is investigating log files for clues.
Which of the following commands should the administrator execute?

choices.D: The server has little free memory available and is not using any swap memory, causing slow operations
choices.C: Too many write operations are happening on the server, causing the IO to wait for requests to be served
choices.A: The processes running in the background are causing high load averages
choices.B: The server has not been rebooted for 1,055 days causing old processes to utilize the CPU

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
What's running in the background?

Selected Answer: C
Doesnt show CPU processes, only shows disk and memory usage metrics. Why would the answer be to clear processes when its not even shown in the question?? Answer is obviously C.

Selected Answer: B
B should be

Selected Answer: B
Should be B

questions.question_text:
A technician wants to implement a firewall ACL to block external access to the company's SSH server.
Which of the following should the technician implement to configure the firewall so it will inform the source of the action taken by the ACL?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer: C 
ls(1) — Linux manual page
-Z, --context
 print any security context of each file

Selected Answer: C
-Z, --context
 print any security context of each file

Answer C. ls -Z shows SELinux contexts. 
(ignore the ג€" in the questions. It's a bug in how examtopics displays the "dash". It means "-")
 As an aside, ps -Z displays process SELinux contexts

questions.question_text:
An operator finds a user is having issues with opening certain files.
Which of the following commands would allow the security administrator to list and check the SELinux context?
